pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:0.5.eng: 29. The training rule on what is risky

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū vutthavassā āraññakesu senāsanesu viharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.2.eng: At that time monks who had completed the rainy-season residence were staying in wilderness dwellings.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.3.eng: Thieves who were active during the month of Kattika attacked those monks, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.7.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, āraññakesu senāsanesu viharantena tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.1.7.eng: “Monks, I allow monks who are staying in wilderness dwellings to store one of their three robes in an inhabited area.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū—“bhagavatā anuññātaṃ āraññakesu senāsanesu viharantena tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitun”ti tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitvā atirekachārattaṃ vippavasanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.1.eng: When they heard about this, monks stored one of their three robes in inhabited areas, staying apart from them for more than six days.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.2.pli: Tāni cīvarāni nassantipi vinassantipi ḍayhantipi undūrehipi khajjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.2.eng: The robes were lost, destroyed, burned, and eaten by rats.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.3.eng: As a consequence, those monks became poorly dressed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.6.eng: and they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitvā atirekachārattaṃ vippavasissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.8.eng: “How could those monks store one of their three robes in an inhabited area and then stay apart from it for more than six days?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.9.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitvā atirekachārattaṃ vippavasantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.13.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitvā atirekachārattaṃ vippavasissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.13.eng: “Monks, how could those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.16.1.pli: “Upavassaṃ kho pana kattikapuṇṇamaṃ yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni senāsanāni sāsaṅkasammatāni sappaṭibhayāni tathārūpesu bhikkhu senāsanesu viharanto ākaṅkhamāno tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipeyya, siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno kocideva paccayo tena cīvarena vippavāsāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.16.1.eng: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are considered risky and dangerous. After observing the Kattika full moon that ends the rainy season, a monk who is staying in such a dwelling may, if he so desires, store one of his three robes in an inhabited area so long as he has a reason for staying apart from that robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.17.pli: Chārattaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tena cīvarena vippavasitabbaṃ. Tato ce uttari vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:1.2.17.eng: He should stay apart from that robe for six days at the most. If he stays apart from it longer than that, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.3.eng: The Kattika full moon that ends the rainy season:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.4.eng: the fourth full moon of the rainy season in the month of Kattika is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.5.pli: Yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni senāsanānīti

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.7.eng: it is at least 800 meters away from any inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.7.comm: That is, five hundred bow-lengths. For further discussion of the dhanu, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.9.pli: ārāme ārāmūpacāre corānaṃ niviṭṭhokāso dissati, bhuttokāso dissati, ṭhitokāso dissati, nisinnokāso dissati, nipannokāso dissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.9.eng: in the monastery, or in the vicinity of the monastery, thieves have been seen camping, eating, standing, sitting, or lying down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.11.pli: ārāme ārāmūpacāre corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.11.eng: in the monastery, or in the vicinity of the monastery, thieves have been seen injuring, robbing, or beating people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.12.eng: A monk who is staying in such a dwelling:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.13.eng: a monk who is staying in that kind of dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.17.pli: saṅghāṭiṃ vā uttarāsaṅgaṃ vā antaravāsakaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.17.eng: the outer robe, the upper robe, or the sarong.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.18.eng: May store in an inhabited area:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.19.eng: may store it anywhere in his alms village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.20.pli: Siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno kocideva paccayo tena cīvarena vippavāsāyāti
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.20.eng: So long as he has a reason for staying apart from that robe:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.21.eng: if there is a reason, if there is something to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.22.pli: Chārattaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tena cīvarena vippavasitabbanti
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.22.eng: He should stay apart from that robe for six days at the most:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.23.eng: he should stay apart from it for six days at a maximum.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.24.eng: Except if the monks have agreed:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.26.eng: If he stays apart from it longer than that:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.27.eng: the robe becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the seventh day.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.28.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.28.eng: The robe should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.29.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.30.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.31.pli: idaṃ me, bhante, cīvaraṃ atirekachārattaṃ vippavutthaṃ, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.31.eng: ‘Venerables, this robe, which I have stayed apart from for more than six days without the agreement of the monks, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.32.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.35.eng: ‘I give this robe back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.36.1.pli: Atirekachāratte atirekasaññī vippavasati, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.36.1.eng: If it is more than six days and he perceives it as more, and he is staying apart from it, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.37.pli: Atirekachāratte vematiko vippavasati, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.37.eng: If it is more than six days, but he is unsure of it, and he is staying apart from it, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.38.pli: Atirekachāratte ūnakasaññī vippavasati, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.38.eng: If it is more than six days, but he perceives it as less, and he is staying apart from it, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.39.eng: If the determination has not been given up, but he perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.40.eng: If it has not been given away, but he perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.41.eng: If it has not been lost, but he perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.42.eng: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.43.eng: If it has not been burned, but he perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.44.pli: avilutte viluttasaññī vippavasati, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.44.eng: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, and he is staying apart from it, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.45.pli: Nissaggiyaṃ cīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.45.eng: If he uses a robe that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.46.eng: If it is less than six days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.47.eng: If it is less than six days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.48.eng: If it is less than six days and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.50.eng: if he stays apart from the robe for six days;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.51.eng: if he stays apart from the robe for less than six days;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.52.pli: chārattaṃ vippavasitvā puna gāmasīmaṃ okkamitvā vasitvā pakkamati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.52.eng: if, after staying apart from it for six days, he stays overnight within the village zone and then leaves;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.52.comm: “Zone” renders sīmā. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.53.pli: antochārattaṃ paccuddharati, vissajjeti, nassati, vinassati, ḍayhati, acchinditvā gaṇhanti, vissāsaṃ gaṇhanti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.53.eng: if within the six days he gives up the determination, or the robe has been given away, lost, destroyed, burned, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.53.comm: “Taken on trust” refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.54.eng: if he has the permission of the monks;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.56.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np29:2.57.eng: The training rule on what is risky, the ninth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:0.5.eng: 3. The third training rule on the robe season

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno akālacīvaraṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.2.eng: a monk had been given robe-cloth outside the robe season.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.3.eng: While he was making the robe, he realized there was not enough cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.4.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu taṃ cīvaraṃ ussāpetvā punappunaṃ vimajjati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.4.eng: Lifting it up, he smoothed it out again and again.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.4.comm: Sp 1.497: Tattha ussāpetvā punappunaṁ vimajjatīti “valīsu naṭṭhāsu idaṁ mahantaṁ bhavissatī”ti maññamāno udakena siñcitvā pādehi akkamitvā hatthehi ussāpetvā ukkhipitvā piṭṭhiyaṁ ghaṁsati, taṁ ātape sukkhaṁ paṭhamappamāṇameva hoti. So punapi tathā karoti, “In regard to this ussāpetvā punappunaṁ vimajjati means: thinking, ‘When the wrinkles disappear, it will be larger,’ he would sprinkle it with water, step on it with his feet, and then lifting and holding it up with his hands, he would rub it against his back. But when dried in the sun, it returned to its initial size. He would then do it again.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.5.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto taṃ bhikkhuṃ taṃ cīvaraṃ ussāpetvā punappunaṃ vimajjantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.5.eng: While walking about the dwellings, the Buddha saw that monk acting in this way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.6.pli: Disvāna yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.6.eng: He went up to him and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.7.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, bhikkhu, imaṃ cīvaraṃ ussāpetvā punappunaṃ vimajjasī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.8.eng: “Sir, I’ve been given this out-of-season robe-cloth,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.9.eng: but it’s not enough to make a robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.10.pli: Tenāhaṃ imaṃ cīvaraṃ ussāpetvā punappunaṃ vimajjāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.10.eng: That’s why I lift it up and smooth it out again and again.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.11.eng: “Are you expecting to receive more cloth?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā, bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.13.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.14.eng: “Monks, I allow you to keep out-of-season robe-cloth if you are expecting to receive more.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū—“bhagavatā anuññātaṃ akālacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā cīvarapaccāsā nikkhipitun”ti akālacīvarāni paṭiggahetvā atirekamāsaṃ nikkhipanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.1.eng: When they heard about this, some monks kept out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.2.eng: keeping them in bundles on a bamboo robe rack.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.3.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā ānando senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto tāni cīvarāni cīvaravaṃse bhaṇḍikābaddhāni tiṭṭhante.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.3.eng: While walking about the dwellings, Venerable Ānanda saw that robe-cloth,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.1.eng: “It’s our out-of-season robe-cloth, which we’re keeping because we’re expecting more.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.2.eng: “But how long have you kept it?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.4.eng: Venerable Ānanda complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū akālacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā atirekamāsaṃ nikkhipissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.5.eng: “How can these monks keep out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando te bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.6.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū akālacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā atirekamāsaṃ nikkhipantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.10.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā akālacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā atirekamāsaṃ nikkhipissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.10.eng: “How can those foolish men keep out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.12.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.13.1.pli: “Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine bhikkhuno paneva akālacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.13.1.eng: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe season has ended, if out-of-season robe-cloth is offered to a monk, he may receive it if he wishes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.14.eng: If he receives it, he should quickly make a robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.15.pli: No cassa pāripūri, māsaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ ūnassa pāripūriyā satiyā paccāsāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.15.eng: If there is not enough cloth, but he is expecting more, he should keep it at most one month to make up the lack.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.16.pli: Tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya, satiyāpi paccāsāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.16.eng: If he keeps it longer than that, then even if he expects more cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.2.pli: bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvarāsā vā upacchinnā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.2.eng: the monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth has been lost, destroyed, or burned; or his expectation of receiving further robe-cloth is disappointed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.2.comm: This refers to the robe-cloth received during the robe season. For details see Kd 7:1.7.3–13.2.7.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.4.pli: aṭṭhannaṃ mātikānaṃ aññatarāya mātikāya ubbhataṃ hoti, saṅghena vā antarā ubbhataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.4.eng: it has ended according to one of the eight key phrases or the Sangha has ended it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.4.comm: For an explanation of this see Kd 7:1.7.3–12.1.37 and Bi Pc 30:1.1.8.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.6.eng: for one who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is robe-cloth given during the eleven months.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.6.comm: That is, in-season robe-cloth is cloth obtained during the last month of the rainy season, while out-of-season robe-cloth is cloth obtained during the remaining eleven months of the year. Bu NP 28:2.9: Cīvarakālasamayo nāma anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso, “Cīvarakālasamaya: for one who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is the last month of the rainy season.” Kkh: Akālacīvaraṁ nāma yvāyaṁ “anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso … ”ti cīvarakālo vutto, taṁ ṭhapetvā aññadā uppannaṁ … etaṁ akālacīvaraṁ nāma, “Akālacīvara: when the robe-making ceremony has not been performed, then the last month of the rainy season … is called the robe season. Apart from that, what is given at other times … this is called out-of-season robe-cloth.” “Robe-making ceremony” refers to the kathina saṅghakamma, the making of the kathina robe, and the rejoicing in the process, the three together represented by the words (an)atthate kathine. For further discussion of the meaning of kathina, see Appendix of Technical Terms. For the rendering of cīvara as “robe-cloth”, see the same appendix.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.7.eng: for one who has participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is robe-cloth given during the seven months.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.7.comm: That is, in-season robe-cloth is cloth obtained during the last month of the rainy season or during the cold season, while out-of-season robe-cloth is cloth obtained during the remaining seven months of the year. Bu NP 28:2.9: Cīvarakālasamayo nāma … atthate kathine pañcamāsā, “Cīvarakālasamaya: … for one who has participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is the five month period.” Kkh: Akālacīvaraṁ nāma yvāyaṁ “… atthate kathine pañcamāsā”ti cīvarakālo vutto, taṁ ṭhapetvā aññadā uppannaṁ … etaṁ akālacīvaraṁ nāma, “Akālacīvara: … when the robe-making ceremony has been performed, then the five-month period is called the robe season. Apart from that, what is given at other times … this is called out-of-season robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.8.pli: kālepi ādissa dinnaṃ, etaṃ akālacīvaraṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.8.eng: Also, if it is given in the robe season, but the cloth is designated, it is called “out-of-season robe-cloth”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.8.comm: Sp 1.499: Kālepi ādissa dinnanti saṅghassa vā “idaṁ akālacīvaran”ti uddisitvā dinnaṁ, ekapuggalassa vā “idaṁ tuyhaṁ dammī”ti dinnaṁ, “‘Also, if it is given in the robe season’: it is given to the Sangha after designating it by saying, ‘This is out-of-season robe-cloth,’ or it is given to an individual by saying, ‘I give this to you.’” In other words, “designated” means designated as out-of-season cloth or designated to an individual. Sp 2.740, commenting on Bi Np 2, adds that designating to a group is included in designated cloth: Ādissa dinnanti sampattā bhājentūti vatvāpi idaṁ gaṇassa idaṁ tumhākaṁ dammīti vatvā vā dātukamyatāya pādamūle ṭhapetvā vā dinnampi ādissa dinnaṁ nāma hoti; etaṁ sabbampi akālacīvaraṁ, “‘Given after designating’: also if they give after saying, ‘Let those who are present share it out,’ or after saying, ‘I give this to the group, to you,’ or they place it at the feet (of the recipient) wishing to give, this is called ‘given after designating’. All this is called out-of-season robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.10.pli: uppajjeyya saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.10.eng: If it is offered by a sangha, by a group, by a relative, or by a friend, or if it is rags, or if he got it by means of his own property.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.12.eng: if he desires, he may receive it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.13.eng: If he receives it, he should quickly make a robe:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.14.eng: it should be made within ten days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.14.comm: That is, in accordance with the stipulations of Bu NP 1:2.17.1.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.15.eng: If there is not enough cloth:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.16.eng: if there is not enough cloth when the robe is being made.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.17.pli: Māsaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbanti
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.17.eng: He should keep it at most one month:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.18.eng: he should keep it one month at a maximum.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.20.eng: for the purpose of making up the lack.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.22.pli: paccāsā hoti saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.22.eng: he is expecting more from a sangha, from a group, from a relative, or from a friend, or he is expecting to get rags, or he is expecting to get it by means of his own property.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.1.pli: Tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya satiyāpi paccāsāyāti
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.1.eng: If he keeps it longer than that, then even if he expects more cloth:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.2.pli: tadahuppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, dasāhā kāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.2.eng: if he is given the expected robe-cloth on the same day as he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.3.pli: Dvīhuppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, dasāhā kāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.3.eng: If he is given the expected robe-cloth the day after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.3.comm: The Pali idiom is such that dvīhuppanne, literally, “given two days ago”, actually means given on the day after he received the original piece of cloth. The way this works, it seems, is that the day on which the cloth was received counts as one. I do the equivalent adjustment for each case below. See also the definition of ten days at Bu NP 1:3.2.2, where the eleventh dawn means the tenth dawn after one received the cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.4.eng: If he is given the expected robe-cloth two days after …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.11.pli: dasāhuppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, dasāhā kāretabbaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.21.pli: vīse uppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, dasāhā kāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.21.eng: … nineteen days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.22.pli: Ekavīse uppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, navāhā kāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.22.eng: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within nine days.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.23.eng: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty-one days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within eight days. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.30.pli: ekūnatiṃse uppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, ekāhaṃ kāretabbaṃ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.30.eng: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty-eight days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within one day.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.31.pli: tiṃse uppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, tadaheva adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ vikappetabbaṃ vissajjetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.31.eng: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty-nine days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be determined, assigned to another, or given away on that very day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.31.comm: Again, in the Pali idiom, tiṁse uppanne, literally, “given thirty days ago”, actually means given twenty-nine days ago.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.32.pli: No ce adhiṭṭheyya vā vikappeyya vā vissajjeyya vā, ekatiṃse aruṇuggamane nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.32.eng: If he does not determine it, assign it to another, or give it away, it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the thirtieth day.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.33.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.33.eng: The robe-cloth should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.34.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.35.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.36.pli: idaṃ me, bhante, akālacīvaraṃ māsātikkantaṃ nissaggiyaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.36.eng: ‘Venerables, this out-of-season robe-cloth, which I have kept for more than a month, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.37.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.40.eng: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.41.pli: Visabhāge uppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, rattiyo ca sesā honti, na akāmā kāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.41.eng: If he is given the expected robe-cloth, but it is different from the robe-cloth originally given to him, and there are days remaining, he does not have to make a robe if he does not want to.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.1.eng: If it is more than a month and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.2.eng: If it is more than a month, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.3.eng: If it is more than a month, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.4.eng: If it has not been determined, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.5.eng: If it has not been assigned to another, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.5.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.6.eng: If it has not been given away, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.7.eng: If it has not been lost, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.8.eng: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.9.eng: If it has not been burned, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.10.eng: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.11.pli: Nissaggiyaṃ cīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.11.eng: If he uses robe-cloth that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.12.eng: If it is less than a month, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.13.eng: If it is less than a month, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.14.eng: If it is less than a month and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.2.pli: antomāse adhiṭṭheti, vikappeti, vissajjeti, nassati, vinassati, ḍayhati, acchinditvā gaṇhanti, vissāsaṃ gaṇhanti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.2.eng: if within a month it has been determined, assigned to another, given away, lost, destroyed, burned, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.2.comm: “Taken on trust” refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.5.eng: The third training rule on the robe season, the third, is finished.
